Description: Dyvân militaire, one of two studies for Plate 85 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; meeting-room interior with a circle of seated Arabs, two European soldiers standing at r Pen and grey ink, with grey wash
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by Jacques Joseph Coiny. There is no copy of Denon's 'Voyage...' in the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12. The minutes of the Trustees' meeting on 12th December, 1835, record that "two or three" of the drawings were missing when the group was offered to the Museum.
Exhibition history: 1983 May-Jul, Brighton AG, 'Egypt & The British', no. 52 1983 Aug-Sep, Manchester AG, 'Egypt & The British', no. 52
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
